summary: The "Improving Newborn Formula Access for a Nutritious Tomorrow Act of 2025" (INFANT Act of 2025) amends the Child Nutrition Act of 1966. It modifies the competitive bidding process for infant formula manufacturers within the Special Supplemental Nutrition Program for Women, Infants, and Children (WIC). The bill allows for the designation of two manufacturers (primary and secondary), alters language related to manufacturer selection, and updates related clauses in the existing act.
